name: Sediment Balance (transport/deposition/turbidity)
functionStatement: Balanced sediment supply and transport preserves bed elevations, substrate sizes, spawning/benthic habitats, and supports riparian succession.
descriptionMarkdown: "Fine input aligns with transport, unless higher turbidity/fines are historically normal (e.g., blackwater). Deposition matches natural form, no severe bar formation beyond typical references. Flow/slope balance incoming sediment, avoiding major bars or deep scour, unless imbalance is historically normal."
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Review available turbidity or TSS data and visually assess bed fines. Where data are absent, infer risk from land use and soils. Delineate bar types (point, mid-channel, lateral) and compare to expected morphology for the channel type. Screen stream power using discharge and slope and compare with observed bars or scour. Detailed transport modeling is beyond screening."

inputs.label: Sediment Balance (transport/deposition/turbidity)
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Low chronic turbidity and minimal fines, or regionally normal conditions. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Minor silt layers or partial turbidity. / High turbidity or moderate silt coverage. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Severe siltation or turbidity that smothers substrate. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
